resources.string:
Greenhouse gas emissions, converted into CO₂-equivalent, rely on average emission factors for each category, based on the typical conditions of a scouting camp

   • ***Catering***: The estimation focuses on lunch and dinner, with average emission factors for each type of meal. It does not consider seasonality, distance to producers, number of intermediary resellers, etc.

   • ***Cooking***: The estimation is based on average cooking time, without accounting for actual conditions: cover, protection against wind, size of pans, end of cooking with gas off.
     If not cooked with gas, meals are supposed to be cooked with wood fire, with no carbon impact. In a sustainably managed forest, one can consider that trees grow and store carbon at the same pace as emissions by wood burning. Note that this reasoning is only valid in the long term (30 years). In the shorter term, wood burning produces CO₂.

   • ***Transports and on-site mobility***: estimations rely on average-sized vehicles.
     If you use a bus between the train station and the camp site, consider it as on-site mobility. More generally, if you use several means of transportation, enter the one that is used on the longest distance as the trip to the camp site, and the other one(s) as on-site mobility.
    On-site mobility over short distances by train, bus, or boat have a negligible impact and are not considered.

    • ***Gear***: Emissions are estimated based on typical scouting gear (tools, cooking gear…). Most of the emissions stem from metal gear. Unlike tents, no amortization is considered. Rather, gear acquired for a camp is assigned to this camp.

    • ***Accommodation***: The estimation assumes an amortization of tents over 5 years and heavy tents over 8 years, based on typical patrol tents and 12-m heavy tents, respectively. Buildings are assumed to be used 4 months a year (holiday facility).

    • ***Specific actions*** : The impact of sea scouting mainly stems from the transport of ships, as well as their amortization over 30 years (50 years for Optimists, 10 years for Zodiacs). Most other activities typical of a scouting camp can be considered as included in the purchase of material.

The graph displays the shares of greenhouse gases emitted by the camp.\nThe green circle allows to compare them with acceptable emissions, i.e., emissions compatible with climate preservation. They amount to 5.5 kg CO₂-equivalent per person and per day.

Scientists estimate that climate preservation requires to restrict greenhouse gases to 2 tons CO₂-equivalent per person and per year, i.e., 5.5 kg CO₂-equivalent per person and per day. \n\nEmissions by the camp are scaled to its duration and number of participants, and compared to this reference.

Pedagogic ressources (in French) on the climate impact of scouting activities, based on the app:
 
   • For chiefs: https://bibli.eeudf.org/?p=8989
   • For youths (16-18 years): https://bibli.eeudf.org/?p=8975
   • For youths (14-16 years) : https://bibli.eeudf.org/?p=8982

The app estimates the order of magnitude of the main greenhouse gas emissions by a scouting camp. It considers transportation, catering, and gear.

It does not consider:
   • waste handling
   • specific activities
   • scouting activities during the schoolyear
   • emissions related to personal gear of participants
   • emissions due to the transport of participants from home to the meeting place before the travel to the camp site
   • participants' emissions other than related to the camp, that continue during the camp. This include for example their home.

For optimal accuracy, an assessment by a qualified expert is required.
• climatmundi, EEUdF greenhouse gas emission assessment, 2008\n\u0020\u0020\u0020• Ademe, bilans-ges.ademe.fr\n\u0020\u0020\u0020• Carbone 4, www.carbone4.com/analyse-faq-voiture-electrique

Jérémie Balas, Éléonore Berger, Louise de Boysson, Suzanne Chevrel, Flore-Anne de Clermont, Matthieu Escande, Yolène Guihard, Daniel Hollaar, Hervé Kasparian, Agathe Lafont, Thomas Masseran, Juliette Maupas, Alexia Peyrard, Roxane de Pol, Paul Manguy, Clément Sartron
Use sliders to parametrize you camp and evaluate its greenhouse gas emissions
Evaluate and reduce the climate impact of your camp with the Scouting camp CO₂ budget app
If the camp lasts longer, travels will be amortised over more days
meal with beef, veal or lamb

Meals with beef, veal, or lamb meat emit much greenhouse gases: almost 5 times more than other meats, and 12 times more than a vegetarian meal. This is probably the easiest opportunity to reduce greenhouse gases without affecting the core project or the camp. La Marmite Éclairée helps you design environmentally friendly menus
meals with beef, veal or lamb
Including porc, poultry, rabbit, or fish in a meal doubles its carbon impact as compared to a vegetarian meal. La Marmite Éclairée helps you design environmentally friendly menus
To further reduce climate impact, prefer fresh, local, seasonal products and minimize packaging. La Marmite Éclairée helps you design environmentally friendly menus

Ideas to reduce gas consumption: cover pans, protect burners from wind, limit the amounts of food or water to heat according to the actual needs, stop gas slightly before the end of cooking and let it finish with the accumulated heat.
Trip to the camp and back

A nearby camp site limits the distance travelled, and allows to choose less harmful transportation means. Except if the short distance translates into many roundtrips by car. 

Tip
If you use several means of transportation, select here the one that is used on the longer distance. The remaining move can be included in the "On-site mobility" section below.
Trip to the camp and back

Train and boat are by far the less carbon-intensive means of transportation. For complex trips across Europe, German Railways provide excellent timetable information. Also, Interrail is often cost-effective for long travels in Europe
Trip to the camp and back
A bus is relevant if full. With 10 person on board, it pollutes as much as a car. Also, avoid empty trips back.
Trip to the camp and back

Distances travelled can be reduced by renting a vehicle on site rather than in your home place. If participants are driven by their parents on the camp site, organize carpooling to reduce the number of cars.
Trip to the camp and back

An electric car emits half greenhouse gases as compard to a regular one. This is still much more than train, boat, or a fully booked bus. If participants are driven by their parents on the camp site, organize carpooling to reduce the number of cars.
Trip to the camp and back
Airplane is doubly polluting: because it emits much CO₂ per kilometer, and because it allows long-haul travel that would be impossible otherwise.
Trip to the camp and back
Sending gear and get it delivered on the camp site pollutes in general less than transporting it by oneself, especially in a half-empty van.
Trip to the camp and back
Shipping in advance allows to use slower transport: less expensive and less polluting.
Bus is efficient if reasonnably full
Shopping nearby to the camp site spares gasoline as well as drivers tiredness. Anticipating needs and writing clear shopping lists allows to group trips and avoids last-minute roundtrips.

Shopping nearby to the camp site spares gasoline as well as drivers\' time and tiredness. Anticipating needs and writing clear shopping lists allows to group trips and avoids many last-minute roundtrips.
Well-maintained gear lasts longer, and therefore pollutes less.
Well-maintained tents last longer, and therefore pollute less.
Well-maintained tents last longer, and therefore pollute less.
Sleeping in tents is not only more fun, it also pollutes less than using buildings.
The impact of a ship mainly stems from its manufacturing. Maintenance is essential to ensure a long life
The impact of a ship mainly stems from its manufacturing. Maintenance is essential to ensure a long life
The impact of a ship mainly stems from its manufacturing. Maintenance is essential to ensure a long life
The impact of a ship mainly stems from its manufacturing. Maintenance is essential to ensure a long life
The impact of a ship mainly stems from its manufacturing. Maintenance is essential to ensure a long life. This is particularly true for the motor
To reduce fuel consumption, avoid sharp accelerations and keep the motor off whenever safety conditions allow it

Greenhouse gas emissions, converted into CO₂-equivalent, rely on average emission factors for each category, based on the typical conditions of a congress
   
   • ***Catering***: The estimation focuses on lunch and dinner, with average emission factors for each type of meal. It does not consider seasonality, distance to producers, number of intermediary resellers, etc.

   • ***Transports and local transit***: estimations rely on average-sized vehicles.

   • ***Accessories offered or received***: Emissions are estimated based on typical values for objects in each category.

The graph displays the shares of greenhouse gases emitted by the congress.\nThe green circle allows to compare them with acceptable emissions, i.e., emissions compatible with climate preservation. They amount to 5.5 kg CO₂-equivalent per person and per day.

Scientists estimate that climate preservation requires to restrict greenhouse gases to 2 tons CO₂-equivalent per person and per year, i.e., 5.5 kg CO₂-equivalent per person and per day. \n\nEmissions by the congress are scaled to its duration and number of participants, and compared to this reference.

The app estimates the order of magnitude of the main greenhouse gas emissions by a congress. It considers transportation, catering, accomodation, and accessories.

It does not consider:
   • waste handling
   • specific activities
   • emissions related to personal gear of participants
   • participants' emissions other than related to the camp, that continue during the congress. This include for example their home.

For optimal accuracy, an assessment by a qualified expert is required.
Thanks to Omar Belkacem, Emeline Bolmont, Imad Bouibed, Liam Burke, Jacques Erard, Hervé Kasparian, Gregory Rohrer, Patrick Roth, and Marlyne Sahakian for their support and advice
Meals with beef, veal, or lamb
Meals with porc, poultry, or Fish
meals with beef, veal, or lamb
meals with porc, poultry, or Fish
Public transit home ↔︎ train station or airport
Taxi home ↔︎ train station or airport
Youth hostel, economy hotel, rented flat
If the congress lasts longer, travels will be amortised over more days

Meals with beef, veal, or lamb meat emit much greenhouse gases: almost 5 times more than other meats, and 12 times more than a vegetarian meal. \nIf you organize the catering, you can offer attractive vegetarian options. If participants eat on their own, you may put forward vegetarian offers in the neighborhood.

Including porc, poultry, rabbit, or fish in a meal doubles its carbon impact as compared to a vegetarian meal. \nIf you organize the catering, you can offer attractive vegetarian options. If participants eat on their own, you may put forward vegetarian offers in the neighborhood.

To further reduce climate impact, prefer fresh, local, seasonal products and minimize packaging. \nIf you organize catering, you can take these aspects into account when designing menus. If participants eat on their own, you may put forward local and seasonal offers in the neighborhood.
Coffee, like other exotic products and especially those cultivated on deforested land, implies strong greenhouse gas emissions

Train (and boat) are by far the less carbon-intensive means of transportation. \nAs an organizer, you can help participants to use the train by choosing an adequate venue and adapted schedule, as well as by providing relevant information. For complex trips across Europe, German Railways provide excellent timetable information.

For a given distance, air travel emits at least 100 times more CO₂ than train. \nAs an organizer, you can help participants to use the train by choosing an adequate venue and adapted schedule, as well as by providing relevant information. For complex trips across Europe, German Railways provide excellent timetable information.
Air travel is particularly strong CO₂ emission sources. For short presentations, videoconferencing may be an alternative.
Traveling in business class emits at least twice as much CO₂ as in economy class
Traveling in business class emits at least twice as much CO₂ as in economy class
For participants whose on-site participation is not required, videoconferencing may be an alternative to reduce the impact of travels, but also of accommodation
Public transit emits much less CO₂ than the same trip by taxi or by car
Taxi emits twice as much CO₂ than bus and 100 times more than subway or train
Public transit emits much less CO₂ than the same trip by taxi or by car

Public transit emits much less CO₂ than the same trip by taxi or by car.\nAs an organizer, you may inform participants on how to reach the venue by public transport and offer a public transport card with the registration.

Taxi emits twice as much CO₂ than bus and 100 times more than subway or train. \nAs an organizer, you may inform participants on how to reach the venue by public transport and offer a public transport card with the registration
CO₂ emissions of a hotel room are directly related to its size
CO₂ emissions of the congress center are directly related to the surface used. You may reduce these emissions by scaling the buildign use to the actual needs
Textile and electronics are particularly CO₂ emitting, let aside other environmental impacts. You may question the need for these objects, and push exhibitors to do so as well
A USB stick implies as much CO₂ emissions than printing 40 pages. On-line program availability may be an alternative.
Printing 40 pages implies as much CO₂ emissions as a USB stick. On-line program availability may be an alternative.
Staying longer at destination by coupling travels limits transportation cost, time, and CO₂ emissions
Meals with beef, veal, or lamb meat emit much greenhouse gases: almost 5 times more than other meats, and 12 times more than a vegetarian meal.
Including porc, poultry, rabbit, or fish in a meal doubles its carbon impact as compared to a vegetarian meal.
To further reduce climate impact, prefer fresh, local, seasonal products and minimize packaging.
If your on-site participation is not required, videoconferencing may be an alternative to reduce the impact of travels, but also of accommodation
Train (and boat) are by far the less carbon-intensive means of transportation. \nFor complex trips across Europe, German Railways provide excellent timetable information.

For a given distance, air travel emits at least 100 times more CO₂ than train. \nFor complex trips across Europe, German Railways provide excellent timetable information. Remote participation may also provide an alternative
Traveling in business class emits at least twice as much CO₂ as in economy class
Taxi emits twice as much CO₂ than bus and 100 times more than subway or train.
Textile and electronics are particularly CO₂ emitting, let aside other environmental impacts. Ask yourself if you really need them.
A USB stick implies as much CO₂ emissions than printing 40 pages. Accessing the program on-line may be an alternative.
40 printed pages imply as much CO₂ emissions as a USB stick. Accessing the program on-line may be an alternative.
